intro: Spergularia pycnantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland sandy habitats.
